185822455.review: I absolutely love this game and it's a real shame its not getting the attention it deserves. It's one of those games that I'll never get bored of and can always jump back in at any moment. Best part of the game was the WW2 Push servers and Dunder Mifflin TTT, but there isn't enough people playing now to host them. I only have three feature requests. Firstly, please add higher difficulty bots for single player since there isn't any actual people left to play with. Secondly, to be able to quickly pull out a handgun with your right hand without freeing your left hand from your primary gun, if that makes sense. And third, to be able to customize the time length of single player matches. Great game and would highly recommend. Keep up the good work guys.

1. Game was very good
2. Then workshop support was removed in favor of some third-party mod website, many mods (all which I used to play) weren't ported over
3. Then the game has become insanely unoptimized, I couldn't smoothly play it on a Ryzen 7 7800X3D + 64 GB DDR5 RAM + RTX 4080 Super
4. Then the game just stopped running at all. I tried troubleshooting but it just kept saying something like "Unreal Engine — SteamVR plugin was not found…" And found a lot of people online who had the same problem and they, too, never succeeded in fixing it

So currently it doesn't even run. And even if it did it's unplayable anyway. Well, it was good while it lasted. :(
#stopkillinggames

185157493.review:
UE5的更新使得社区地图奔溃，这对于地图作者来说简直是灾难，第三方社区地图的生态需要很长时间去恢复。
从创意工坊使用的依赖转移到Mod.io对于中国玩家也是灾难性的打击，中国大陆地区难以直接访问mod.io，中国社区花费了大量的时间去改DNS，VPN这种东西，造成了本就为数不多的中国玩家的流失。
然而，Pavlov VR在VR届如同cs一般的存在，ue4 升级到 ue5 好比是 cs1.6进化到失败的css。不得不说游戏有很大的潜力，很希望Vankrupt能做出正确的决策引导这款游戏。

The update of UE5 has caused community maps to crash frequently, which is undoubtedly a disaster for map creators, and it will take a long time for the ecosystem of community maps to recover. The shift of dependencies from the Steam Workshop to Mod.io has also been a catastrophic blow to Chinese players, as mainland China has difficulty accessing Mod.io directly. The Chinese community has had to spend a lot of time modifying DNS and using VPNs, which has led to the loss of the already limited number of Chinese players. However, Pavlov VR holds a position in the VR world akin to that of CS, and the transition from UE4 to UE5 is akin to the failed evolution from CS1.6 to CSS. It must be said that the game has great potential, and it is hoped that Vankrupt can make the right decisions to guide the game.

185077715.review:
Let me start by saying, Pavlov is a super fun time. Its basically Counter Strike in VR. Guns are probably the most fun and interactive on VR that I have tried. I have made a ton of amazing friends and while the community itself can be toxic (Xbox Lobby Bros who are shitty human beings and children screaming slurs constantly) the game itself is a great time. 

The problem I have with this game is every time there is an update, they break compatibility with certain VR headsets and controllers. I've spent months waiting for patches just so I can play this game with my friends. With the most recent update, this has happened again and its frustrating to have to troubleshoot your hardware and software every time a new update comes out just to get the game to work. On top of which, Pavlov's discord keeps kicking me before I can reach out for technical support. As far as I know I am not banned for inappropriate behavior, but as it stands I can't play a game I have put more than 300+ hours into because Dave and the Dev team can't get their shit together after each update. Each update, which only comes out once a year at this point.

184923079.review:
This title went through a lot in its lifetime — legacy version removal, engine swap, cross-play integration and busted modding support, up to addition of micro-transactions as of late. If anything, each update was a downgrade rather than an innovation, accompanied by rapidly declining playerbase as a result. Pavlov is not dead, as many presume, but it deteriorates each year, besides performing "better" than similar titles.

It was really fun in the past, thus it is not worth buying today. Base game content doesn't provide the same value the modding content did. All major changes are unasked for and irreversible, every patch drags the game down and the community can only watch it happen in despair. It became a VR clone of Counter-strike and this decision alone made it lose all of the potential for future development. The mascot for this game looks like AI-generated nightmare, I still do not realize why it exist in the first place.

Recoil is the highest among other VR shooters and it currently takes the most hits to kill an enemy as well. It doesn't mean that targets feel like bullet-sponges, but it rather allows for less cooperative, strategic and thought-out gameplay. You will find teammates and enemies rushing more, venturing solo often and generally communicating less because of this. It makes the game more self-centric than team-based in a sense.

Virtual hands holding a gun feel like absolute noodles. You will benefit from an improvised or a professional gun rig: it provides you with better handing, immersion and an aspect of realism (like weight distribution, etc.). This goes for the majority of VR shooters that use both controllers for weapon interactions. You can still perform well without, it takes times and practice, however, the handling is still messy due to the lack of a physical constraint a rig can provide.

184881490.review:
The biggest difference for this game between other fps vr shooters is that it has no fluff. It's just raw gunplay which makes pvp more fun. The game is VERY forgiving with weapon handling unlike games like ghost of tabor or Onward.

Don't listen to people complaining about modding. It is very much more accessible to players than before. Playstation will never get modding. That is a SONY issue not Vankrupt's.

Additionally to the complaints of skins, I believe it is completely acceptable. You are directly contributing to development and there is nothing P2W about it. This isn't like rust where there is transparency skins or anything that gives you a tactical advantage.

This is personally my favorite VR game for it's simplicity and fluid handling of gameplay. I'd recommend playing it on the weekends as lately it has been very active as of posting this review.

184863705.review: no steam modding support makes this game feel hollow

184851612.review: literally the best vr shooter u could find, smooth and realistic interactions with guns, realistic graphics and just absolutely fun

184788826.review:
Pavlov VR is a middling VR shooter. Graphics are just okay (5/10).
Gameplay is uninspired (4/10),
with terrible gun handling (3/10).
No body presence and awful IK are major immersion killers. The weapon holsters are the worst I've seen (1/10), 
making grabbing weapons and ammo a constant struggle.

As someone who usually dislikes shooters, I only enjoyed the custom zombie maps. But even that fun was short-lived, with no real replay value.

Overall, Pavlov VR is flawed. The bad far outweighs the good. Only recommended for poeple who can tolerate a lot of jank.

184774006.review: Terrorist Town is very fun when it works, but this game could do with some form of aim assist. If you're not a god at reaction time, you simply cannot enjoy this game outside of Terrorist Town. The damage indicators are also so incredibly subtle that I struggle to find who's shooting at me most of the time, and although virtual stock helps with steadying your aim at range, it can also mess your shots up when in close range. At the end of the day, don't play if you can't hit 90% of your shots, and if you have shaky hands like me, it's virtually impossible to do so. You can just play a form of Terrorist Town in VRChat for free if that's what you really care about.

honest to God just go buy contractors VR you'll be getting way more out of it, than this game I have refunded this game three times now, the reason why I bought it three times and then refunded three times is because I really did want to give this game a chance and i did gameplay wise slower contractors, just to be honest with you, you can't Crouch by pressing down on your right analog stick but you do have to physically get on the ground or crouched on one knee, hell you can even go prone, I gotta to say it's pretty immersive, but that's where all of fun ends,

it's pretty lackluster, it's somewhat like contractors, it does have custom game modes, and maps but not full on conversions you won't be going to Star Wars, Warhammer, or TF2, in VR, like contractors does it's pretty down to earth to be honest, the Gunplay is somewhat awful, mind you a little bit better than contractors, it does punish you for spraying and praying i do like that, but that's where it ends to be honest, to me it's just lacking fun, and players, and more custom stuff, to be honest the whole nine yards,

but because every developer is chicken shit to even to try to make a decent VR game this will do, VR games are so far and few, and I can't find any other multiplayer VR games this WILL have to do, if I had to give this game a rating I'd give it a 5/10 (For the Love of Christ just buy contractors and skip this game all together if you can) (do I hate this game no do I find it not fun yes)

184108999.review:
This game still is one of the best fps vr games out there.

Just keep in mind that they killed the steam workshop. Used to have a ton of awesome and goofy maps and mods.
Sadly enough, this is over.
Now they use mod.io for mods and maps, there are not a lot of mods and maps on there compared to the steam workshop.

But a few good S tier mods and maps are better than none, so i would like to thank those who keep creating mods on a whole different platform.

I would still recommend this game especially if you play it with your friends. It's still worth it.

I just hope they'll bring back the steam workshop at some point...

It's a bit of a mixed feeling for me, disappointed but still fun to play at the same time.

As for the gun skins: A lot of people complain about it, i say; are you not a fan of it? Just don't buy them.

184013210.review:
I hate to give this a thumbs down but the simple fact is, I cannot play it anymore. I've dabbled in it on and off over the years and it's great seeing it develop further, turning into a CoD/CS VR game and modding support to boot, easily one of the best VR shooters I've played. But due to some technical issue it just will not load up for me. 

And yes, this is a problem with [b]my[/b] PC/headset, but hear me out. I've tried EVERYTHING the devs have posted, I've looked at countless posts with the same issue, some more than a year old with no solution, I've reinstalled, deleted the appdata folder, verified files, deleted workshop content, reinstalled a few more times, deleted the appdata folder a few more times, but it just hangs on a black screen. I did get it to boot into the game's opening screen maybe twice but it just freezes up after. I've completely given up on trying to get it to work, I just cannot be bothered with it anymore.
The reason I'm giving it a thumbs down for an issue only myself and a handful of others are struggling with is because of some of the solutions to other problems that I found on their official wiki.
Things like "[i]If you have a very old steam profile picture try changing it to current steam dimensions and standards without transparency.[/i]" and "[i]Another reported solution is going into your system clock, and resetting it. Set your date and time to synchronize on windows.[/i]"
It made me wonder if the solution was to do something so incredibly obscure that would take me an unknown length of time to find. A new steam photo? rearrange my monitors? Change my keyboards lights to a hot pink between the hours of 9am - 6pm?

These random solutions say to me that there's a serious flaw in the way this game is built if it can be bugged out by steam profile photos and resetting my PC's clock to fix a teleporting issue. I've never heard of such things being the cause of a game either being buggy or straight-up not starting. 

There's a serious problem with the foundations of this game and I sincerely hope they patch it up because I miss playing this.

Feels like garbage after H3VR.
Yes, I DO realize it's wrong to compare Pavlov with H3VR since one is a multiplayer game and the other is basically a gun sim, but sheeeeeit man, my eyes are bleeding after playing 40-50 minutes of Pavlov with Rift S. 183679845.review:
[h1] Buy This...If You Want A Solid VR Shooter [/h1]

TL;DR: [spoiler] This game is very much alive, skins aren't the end of the world as some would have you believe and the game feels better than it has in 7 years, people just tend to look at the past with rose-tinted glasses. <3 [/spoiler]

I figured i'd wait until both the end of the year and having over 1000 hours before leaving a review. This game's gone through a [i] roller-coaster of sorts [/i] with both the golden age of 2017 - 2020 and then the Crash of 22' and then with the most recent update I can only really label "Too little too late."

Now let me be clear. This game is [u] probably never going to have the thousand or so players it used to. [/u] That's fine, since you now have the most close-knit 200-300 player PCVR community ever. That's not even counting PSVR Crossplay players.

The game mechanics are the exact same as they were 7 years ago, the guns do the same damage; sound the same etc... For some people it's started to get a bit stale and most people feel a bit angry cheated at how the skin system was rolled out considering we thought we'd get to create our own skins [b] as we have for the last 4 years [/b] or at least vote on the best looking set. Oh well, the devs need to make money somehow I suppose and most of them aren't even 5$.

The only real mode you're probably buying this game for, TTT, is still very active and seems to be markedly less toxic now than it ever has been but if you're here for other game-modes like SND or god-forbid [spoiler] Zombies [/spoiler] ? You're SOL, [i] (and rightfully so, just play Arizona Sunshine.) [/i]

183660486.review: Что за помойка, те кто хвалит её ничего лучше стандоффа не видел. Графика в целом хорошая, пушки и всё такое тоже супер, но нету официальных серверов и это самая большая проблема, в итоге все бегают на парочке серверов орут в чат и занимаются бреднями.

183600825.review:
Verstehe die ganzen negativen Rezensionen nicht. Es ist eine Bewertung des Spiels und dessen Inhalt hat sich sehr gross erweitert was die Mods betrifft.
Ja der ursprüngliche Workshop ist weg und mit dem Workshop auch einige Maps die oft gespielt wurden. 
Dafür gibt es jedoch weit grössere und weitläufigere Maps die zu früheren Zeiten noch nicht möglich waren. Auch Portierungen alter Maps wurden gemacht aber dazu mehr.

Granatwerfer, Claymore Mienen und Gadgets wie C4 mit Funkauslöser sind jetzt dank Mods verfügbar.
Und was die neue Fahrzeugpalette betrifft, davon konnte man früher nur träumen. Strandbuggies mit MG's, Humvees, WW2 Kettenfahrzeuge, Truppentransporter und sogar Hubschrauber sind dank einem Update der Entwickler möglich und befinden sich bereits auf Zahlreichen Maps. 
Ja sogar ein Conquest Modus gibt es jetzt... also was will man noch mehr? Alte maps mit lausiger Grafik die nicht portiert wurden? Ja dann bittet man die Map Entwickler darum, dass sie an Ihrer Map weiter arbeiten und nicht einfach abbrechen. Das gehört nunmal zum Entwickeln dazu oder was wäre wenn alle Handy Apps nicht mehr gehen würden...nur weil ein neues Betriebssystem rausgekommen ist. Für mich ein 1 A Spiel. Es fehlen blos mehr Spieler.

183596166.review: Best VR online experience so far, works well on Linux, the game is a bit unrealistically and unnecessarily over the top gore and one wouldn't know why, because for the most part the setting of the shooter is counter-strike like, you wouldn't think that anyone was looking for that most random element of the shooter, apart from the crazy mods, of course.

183590650.review: People need to stop crying about paid cosmetics being added and no mod support for crossplay lobbies, crossplay has never had mod support for over a year and paid cosmetics are, surprisingly, COSMETIC. You don’t have to buy gun skins and they don’t improve gameplay at all, It’s just a way to support the devs. I do find the fact that they removed the free holiday knife skins and made them paid a bit scummy but then again, these are COSMETICS, not extra content or anything to review bomb over. Now reviewing the actual game, this is one of the most solid vr shooters with really great mod support with a lot of great mods for some of the most dedicated mod devs out of any vr game.

183553447.review: Ist ein gutes Game eigentlich, aber leider tote Server. Es wird halt so gut wie überhaupt nicht mehr gespielt, und wenn dann nur von kleinen Kindern die einen immer anschreien. Also Finger weg von diesem Game. Es ist ein reines Multiplayer und ohne andere Mitspieler einfach nur ein Platzverschwender. Sehr traurig, kann selber nicht verstehen warum die Leute das Game nicht mehr mögen, hat eigentlich sehr viel Potenzial.
